Reviews.Title: “Convenient for attending conference”
Reviews.Author: SooCouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to attend a conference next door. Waited for a bit for the shuttle- had to figure out how to get out of the airport.. why isn't there adequate signage?? In any event, stayed on the 12th floor, reception was quick and painless. Key worked - but lock didn't- maintenance was prompt and fixed the lock asap. Stiff robe and comfortable slippers. Had a couple beverages in the Fox Bistro- I am relieved to know this will be upgraded in the near future. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Had to get used to airplanes flying over the hotel - VERY close to the airport- but going for only one night, we opted for convenience. Planes stopped by 11pm and slept great. Water pressure in shower was awesome. Drank the large bottled water in the room, and noticed the card behind it stating we would be charged $3.50 if consumed... geesshh... had I noticed that I would have got a smaller, colder water from the vending machiene- so don't drink the water in the room if you don't want to be overcharged!! Would return- hotel is clean and if you have to be close to the airport, it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “100% satisfaction? No way!”
Reviews.Author: David Z
Reviews.Content: I have been impressed by Radisson's promise to make sure 100% satisfaction. Otherwise, this hotel claims, "you won't pay." surprisingly, this slogan is at reception, in elevator and in the room. So, let's see how they deliver. In fact, the location is good. There are a few restaurants there. Room is large and comfortable. Bed is soft. It looked all good until the last morning when we faced real challenges. We had stayed in the hotel for two days. I would say hardware of the hotel is better than software. Except a tall lady at the reception and the lady in the breakfast, smile is absorlutely scarce resourse. I even wonder why? Situation got worse finally. On March 17, we would fly to Costa Rica for vacation. My wife got up at 4am to prepare. She wanted to curl her hair with an appliance from China. Unfortunately, the volt converter does not fit socket. So, I called reception. They did get something. Just it is same as mine. I went to lobby and asked for a extension cord, hoping to plug in. However, they got one that is exactly same. What is the point? It is just useless. I ran back and forth for four times(they never sent anything to my room), just to find out disappointment. To make it Worse, the guy at reception had no emotion at all. He never greeted when he called. He didn't have any smile, at all. The worst thing is I finally found out he is a manager(looks like south asian in light suits)! I told I am not satisfied at all. He kept saying, i understand what you say, but this is all I have. Fine, you dont have to help your guests. You don't even know what your guest, or more precisely, your trouble maker(as you are so unhappy), needs. To include, this hotel can't make guests 100%satisfied at all. How could it if staff has a stony face? And never have courtercy? Please! You over promised, and under delivered! A real taboo for doing business.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the IMATS”
Reviews.Author: rorzach r
Reviews.Content: Should have written this ages ago! We travelled to Toronto for the International MakeUp Artists Trade Show in November, 2011. Ibooked a room on the Excutive floor, it was great! Housecoats laid out on the bed, free internet, clean and spacious living rm area and the bedrm was a great size with 2 Queen size Sleep number beds, my 1st time on one, not particularily fond of it, but the bedding was crisp and clean and it was a great experience, it was a short walk to the Congress Centre and the staff was very helpful when we looked into taking the subway downtown, a short busride to the subway stn and in total 45 mins later we were shopping in downtown! Forty mins is nothing, try driving in!....this hotel is close to many different restaurants and fast food places......why fight the traffic? The Fox Stop restaurant is a bit tired looking and could do with a bit of a new look, but hte overall experience at this hotel was wonderful, going to IMATS again next yr and will definitely be staying here again! We had complimentary breakfasts with our room, a breakfast room is on the 5th floor for the Excutive room guests....very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Felt at home”
Reviews.Author: lindabean58
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Radisson at 640 Dixon Road for 3 days in March. I can't say enough about the maids and all the staff at the Radisson. They really try to make your stay just like home. The amenities in the room are excellent. A beautiful king bed (in a separate bedroom) Real creamers for your coffee in the morning. AND .. They still have a few smoking rooms. (for us diehard smokers) I have stayed in many hotels on the airport strip, but have to say that I enjoyed the Radisson best. Thanks to the staff and the 16th floor maid for making my stay very nice. Linda

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the last 15 years”
Reviews.Author: GKoury
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times a year over the last 15 years including this past week and this coming week. The service has been excellent. Any problems with the facilities are taken care of immediately. The hotel is in the process of doing updates including the TV's which one reviewer had complained about. I don't understand that same review's complaint about the beds - the sleep number beds let you adjust the bed hardness to whatever you want. Parking is very easy since it is not a huge hotel where you end up parking a gazillion miles away. The two room suites (all the rooms are two room suites) are a pleasure for the business traveller. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for a stopover.”
Reviews.Author: Het7
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a group of 3 friends in Dec 2011 waiting for a flight the next day, so only stayed overnight as a stopover. Hotel was clean, comfortable and good value. No problems with noise and was nice and warm, despite the -9degrees outside. We only stayed a day and so wanted to make the most of our day in Canada - the receptionist was extremely friendly and helpful, telling us which subway and buses to take to see the things we wanted to, and recommending us places to eat and everything. She also saved our lives, as we had no problems booking the hotel for 3 adults at home..but when we got there were told to be adults there we had to be 21 (we were only 19 and 20) - thank you!! ..So careful not to have the same problem! We didn't use any of the hotel's facilities or food services so can't comment on those, but the hotel is surrounded by a few restaurants and cafes which were welcoming of our custom. The location of the hotel isn't great, but there are plenty of buses and subways which are available in the area (although a bit confusing to use if you haven't before). Nevertheless, a good value for money and an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Kari R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed dozens of times at this hotel and when I have to be in that area it is by far the best choice. The rooms are large enough with separate bedrooms and are always clean and well appointed. Beds are very comfy. Lots of restaurants and convenience stores well with in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back”
Reviews.Author: Rene B
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of booking 4 nights again at this property. Suites, close to the office, good deal, so I thought, why not! The decor is dated in the suites. Old style TVs. The mattress was too firm and could not be adjusted. Aircraft noise was terrible (I had forgotten that). One morning the shuttle left ahead of schedule. One of the front desk employee was quite rude. And to top it off, I got a nasty bug bite. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but watch out for airplane noise”
Reviews.Author: twowheelfever
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Toronto Motorcycle Show 1st week end of January. Booked through Hotwire @ $69 per night + tax in Sept/2011. Thought all was good when we arrived. After settling into the room around 4.00pm we heard the planes in landing mode. Honestly they sounded about 500 ft overhead. This place is not sound absorbing at all. Luckily, air traffic stopped by 11.00pm and did not resume until 6.00am Otherwise, clean room , comfy bed and staff are easy to deal with. Large pool and spa on site. Family friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: ktopo
Reviews.Content: A clean, well appointed, hotel. beds are very comfortable. The only downside was the amount of air traffic. Food was good - catered fro business meetings. Staff were excellent - very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Expedia Banner Adds!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianAnge
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel from across the street (on my blackberry) when I learned I could not extend my existing booking at the Doubletree. Clicked on a link on what appeared to be the Radisson web page. Either Radisson is selling banner adds to Expedia, or Expedia has created clever landing pages that have the look and feel of a Radisson page. The problem arose after I crossed the street to check in at the Radisson - only to be told my 'third party booking' was made for the following night (funny...considering I said 'today'). The lady was absolutely powerless to help me, explaining that my hotel was paid in full and she wouldn't be able to honour the preferred rate. I explained that it was never my intent to book through a third party and that the rate was of no consequence. She encouraged me to call them back to make the change. 20 more minutes of phone time later, Expedia assured me it was fixed (had to get the 'supervisor's approval to honour the same rate - at this point it was about the principal of the matter - ugh). Returned to the desk...only to be told they couldn't yet see it on their systems. Asked if I could give them a credit card to check in while they awaited the 'paperwork' from Expedia (they have no ability to contact them ...despite their observation that 'people book through third parties inadvertently 'often'). By now I'm losing it and I risk being late for my corporate function. Finally Karen came to my rescue. She magically was able to take my credit card to allow me to check in - and just asked that I pop by later to ensure the room was charged appropriately. She upgraded me for my trouble. Room was beautiful, spacious, and very conveniently located to the Congress Centre (walking distance), Tim Horton's for my morning coffee - and gas station for my rental car. Overall it worked out. Feel that if this is the way of the future for hotels, they really have to improve their ability to communicate with the third parties though...I was two minutes away from walking out.

Reviews.Title: “So far the Best Value, Hotel and Service in the Airport Area”
Reviews.Author: badbella
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed having stayed at other hotels in the area, I was expecting the same. But I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. First I checked in and my room was still being cleaned but I asked is there somewhere I could change since I was going to work and they instead upgraded me and gave me a room. Then I ate at their hotel restaurant and it was good! and service awesome. The bed was new and so comfortable, quiet and when I checked out the lady at the desk was fun and very very helpful. I had time to kill so she looked up where a particular store was, called a cab, stored my luggage and then when I came back I picked up my voucher and took the shuttle to the airport. Can't complain about anything

Reviews.Title: “most friendly, convenient, cost effective”
Reviews.Author: GORDON D
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this property, almost from the day it opened, about 5 days permonth, I would unhestitatingly recommend this hotel for the reasons outlined above. I am always welcomed by name, and the staff always looks after my needs immediately. Also important to me, being a sales representative, is the location close to all major highways, and, of course, the airport

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing room”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service after a long drive. We were upgraded to business suite at no charge. Love the layout of the room. Good service including a free shuttle service to the airport. Left the car in the lot for 10 days with no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business trips”
Reviews.Author: mamarica
Reviews.Content: Last week I had to spend two nights in Toronto. I chose the Radisson and was very happy with the set-up. Spacious and comfy

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and appreciated the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Pierre D
Reviews.Content: Arrived from a late evening flight and was greated with a friendly clerk. The room is very nice spacious, and comfortable. I was upgraded to a business suite at no charge. I definitely appreciated that one. The price for one night was the cheapest around the airport and it included a free shuttle srevice. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on Airport Strip”
Reviews.Author: noshenn a
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice and clean, great location, close to the airport, free shuttle bus. friendly staff. Best value for the price. I strongly recommend this hotel.Fox Bistro restaurant is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Margaret G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, nice and close to the Congress Center. The room was spacious, comfortable and very clean....could use some modernization as it appeared a bit dated. Service was quick and efficient. All in all a good hotel at the right price !

Reviews.Title: “Redo this Radisson”
Reviews.Author: ScottyMontana
Reviews.Content: While there's no getting away that this hotel has a great location, it is so out of date inside it is amazing. Don't get me wrong the room was clean and comfortable, but everything was old. The furniture, the carpet, the TVs, the bathroom fixtures...everything. So it is clearly evident they are squeezing everything they can from this property. If you have to stay one night, it's OK, but as it is a suites hotel, I wouldn't stay here for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: “Works for an airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mpsrent
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property at least once a year and just visited again for 3 nights. Great location for anyone who needs to stay on the airport strip. The Toronto airport strip can be a tough location to get into a restaurant most nights and I find it easier to find a table at this end of the strip then the Carlingview Road end. Kelsey's and Milestones restaurants are a 2 minute walk out the front door. All rooms are suite style, though the furniture is somewhat dated. I suspect they are due for rennovations in the next 2 years. Read my note about room selection as this hotel is right on the flight path. Toronto airport is very busy and the planes start landing at 6:30 a.m. with a plane overhead every 3 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Right price. Some Glitches”
Reviews.Author: Tresher32
Reviews.Content: We arrived Friday October 7 and stayed to October 11, The room was a good size, more than what I expected. The location is close to the airport. We ate at two restaurants within the vicinity- Swiss Chalet ( budget friendly and tasty) and Canyon Creek ( a little pricey, but worth it). Housekeeping was excellent for three days, then it went DOWNHILL. On Monday our room was not cleaned. I went to front desk to advise them our room was not cleaned. Instead we were provided the most dingy, greyish looking towels for our room. We laughed and figured it was our last night, so why bother. As I mentioned before the room is excellent. However, that sleep number bed was hell. IT's loud and takes along time to find the right comfort level.It's even worse if your number differs from the person next to you. Let's just say, by the last night we both slept on one side of the bed. Even through, I experienced theses minor glitches , I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel for The Money”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 5:00PM and were checked in promptly. The hotel is located along the Dixon strip, close to the airport and a ton of restaurants. We were given a room on the 5th floor. As we were walking to our room on the 5th floor we were overcome by the strong odor of garbage. We entered the room and it was a bit dated. We also noticed that the bathroom had mud on the floor. Not satisfied, we informed the manager who was very nice and eager to get us moved to an 'executive' room on the 14th floor. This room was cleaner and appeared to be a bit more modern, but still feeling a bit dated. It had a living room with a pull out sofa, a desk area, a wet bar with microwave and mini fridge. The bathroom was small, but functional. The linens were surprisingly nice! The beds were OK, we had a hard time trying to figure out the sleep number system. Being on an executive floor, we had access to the executive lounge which offers free breakfast during weekdays. It was Saturday, so we didn't have a chance to try it. Parking was $14 and free WIFI was offered in the room. The WIFI signal was not the best, but did the job. Staff seemed pleasant. There wasn't a lot of noise. We occasionally heard the odd plane fly over the hotel. Overall, for the money this hotel is OK, especially if you're on a short stay to catch an early flight. I think that in order to remain competitive along the Dixon strip, the hotel will need to invest in some significant upgrades to 'modernize' the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: tammyb051
Reviews.Content: The service was efficient and friendly. The bed was VERY comfortable. There are several restaurants right outside - we chose the grill that was not a chain and the meal was fine. Highly recommended for the night before an early flight - the shuttle (free of charge) runs twice an hour and takes just about 20 mins. In addition, the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved their Beds!”
Reviews.Author: NajeebK
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nothing extraordinary;just a nice clean Radisson. But was very impressed by the "sleep number" bed and their bed linens. Bathrooms were large and everything worked just fine. We had a very friendly maid who provided us with all our needs. Did not try the free breakfast that was included in the room price since we were there for a wedding and our hosts served all our meals. Parking lot and landscaping were not up to par and we did not notice a swimming pool. Paid $87 per night which was reasonable. Check out was painless and quick. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for an overnight before or after a trip”
Reviews.Author: Mindful_Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the executive floor and had a wonderful room that had a sitting area and a large bedroom. It was great to come back from smaller beds in Europe to a night in a King Bed. The hotel has the "Sleep Number" beds which you can set the softness of each side of the bed. Once you get use to using it, it does make for a comfortable nights sleep. Breakfast is included on the executive floor which is a basic continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room For A Nice Prize”
Reviews.Author: Josh V
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation for Sat, Aug 27th, for under $60 per night and found the room nicely clean and well kept. The bed was the slightest bit stiff, although difficult to notice; the living room had a nice chair and desk, as well as coffee table and sofa. Not much else; the breakfast came quick but checking out took a little longer than expected (staff seemed to be rushed by amount of queries by guests and had trouble coping). Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: MTL51446
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the Caribana festival & didn't expect much given the price of the suite during such a busy week-end.. and well we didn't get much. The suite was very average. (this is actually the smallest suite i've seen in my life) Then again for the price, cannot complain too much. The +: The room was clean, the maids nice. There is a Tim Horton next to the hotel & a free navette to the airport. The -: The decor was very cheap/old though just like the hotel restaurant. The "free breakfast" consisted basically of cereals, donuts & fruits... you had to pay for the "hot buffet" as they call it. The hotel attendant was a little rude when we arrived and didn't want to believe us when we told him our deal included free breakfast. We had to give him a proof cause he didn't have it on this system! Don't they say that the client is always right?... Also make sure to check your bill before you leave the hotel, they charged us for parking when we didn't even have a car!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: ChiLuvsToTrav
Reviews.Content: Every January and August, we stay here when we attend the CGTA Toronto Gift Show. The venue(Toronto Congress Centre) is just next door to the hotel. My husband likes a firm bed and I prefer a softer bed. Their king size "sleep number" bed is just perfect for us. This is an all suite hotel which means plenty of room for us. The only thing the hotel needs to improve on is their restaurant food. It is just okay for me.

Reviews.Title: “clean but dated”
Reviews.Author: Brouse_family
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. However the place is very old and it shows, we payed $80 on wagjag thinking we were getting a deal but when we arrived we realized we probably paid what the room was worth. Also there are airplanes that fly over the hotel every 15 minutes, but inside we could not hear them at all but my boys enjoyed looking out the window and seeing them fly by.since they only had 40 channels not including any with cartoons.in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be elctrocuted”
Reviews.Author: Skyburial
Reviews.Content: Radisson stands for quality; "suites" sounds impressive. But when the building is thrown in straight by the airport landing area, with the two main masts for Toronto`s electrical supply on each side, sleeping is an electrical chair light-experience. On top of this, the service was grumpy, the internet overpriced, breakfast - also overpriced - contained nothing resembling healthy food - even the free shuttle, after long waiting hours contained charges equivalent to taking a taxi. My happiest moment at the hotel was on leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly great”
Reviews.Author: zebedeesolive
Reviews.Content: My Air Canada flight was delayed (shocking, I know) and so I had to spend the night here. I wasn't looking forward to it, but I was put up in a junior suite which certainly exceeded my expectations. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean, had a kitchenette and sofe and two tvs (1 in living room, 1 in bedroom). Plus it offers a free shuttle bus. I was overall very impressed and if I was in the area again, would definately stay again. The restuarant was another matter, though. Although the pub/restaurant enivironment and menu were adequate and food I ordered good, the Asian server was uneccsarily rude, impatient, and outright hostile when I asked him questions such as "Can I have some water?" and "Is beer included in the airline food voucher?" Needless to say, a very strange experience and he didn't get a tip. If you don't want to put up with this oddity, there always a Tim Horton's within walking distance to the hotel, which is doubly convenient if you want a coffee before catching an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a suite”
Reviews.Author: Electriques
Reviews.Content: The pluses: I really liked the rooms in this hotel; the suites were a good size and came with a fridge and microwave. The room was clean with decent quality hotel type furnishings (some rooms have more updated furniture than others). The maids was very friendly and even straightened up my shoes! Convenient shuttle to the airport and lots of restaurants right outside the front door. The minuses: The gym was ok; the elliptical was not working properly and one of the treadmills is not so great. The hotel is directly under one of the flight paths of the airport. The planes flying overhead can be quite noisy. if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs. They may land late at night and can start taking off at 6:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Solarachicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last night with our family. The kids and I were almost sick with the foul smell in the room. It smelled at though someone had thrown up in the room and it hadn't been cleaned. The room was very, very dated and not nice at all. We used the sofa bed and upon moving the cushions off the sofa noticed they were covered with pee stains or some kind of stains. I travel a lot and this is one of the worst places I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: beastleys
Reviews.Content: When you see white bedding on the beds you know you are in a clean hotel!! The sleep number beds were nice and ensured a comfortable sleep once we figured out our number. The included breakfast was plentiful and had cold items including fruit salad, and great hot buffet. The shuttle to the airport was every half hour so we didn't have to wait long. I will stay there on my next trip through Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Shudder....ick!”
Reviews.Author: EloquentlyWasted
Reviews.Content: We were given a complimentary room at this hotel for one night after Air Canada made us miss a connecting flight to Alberta from Jamaica. We thought it would be okay, as it was only for one night, near the airport, and as a general rule, Radisson Hotels are okay. THIS PLACE IS A DUMP!!! From the minute we checked in (late at night and without a vehicle), we knew we were in for an unpleasant evening. The service was indifferent, the lobby was tired and old looking, and the place just has a run-down, unkempt atmosphere. That was only the beginning! When we got to our room and opened the door, I thought I'd stepped back into 1986! The decor is so dated it's almost laughable, the sofa was stained, the rug was stained, the television was ANCIENT, the bathroom had a tacky print that they had actually screwed to the wall (like anyone would want to steal it!). The towel rack fell off the wall while we were in the room, and I swear the only thing they've changed in the place since 1986 is the toilet paper rolls! Lets put it this way.....before I would go NEAR the bed I had my husband lift up the mattress so I could check for bedbugs, and then I checked Trip Advisor to make sure nobody had complained of them before I would even put my suitcases on a soft surface in the room! Thankfully that is not something they seem to have a problem with. Seriously though, if anyone says this place is nice, or even "okay", they have extremely low standards and expectations, and they don't mind shelling out money for nothing. I didn't pay for this room, and if I could have reasonably left, I would have.....it was DISGUSTING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good airport choice”
Reviews.Author: JBJOHNSON
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our travel agent as a special for Transat Holidays which included our room for one night and free parking for our 14 day vacation while we were in Mexico and a good rate. The rooms are all suite which was a bedroom with tv, a two part bathroom, and a living room with a mini frig, couch, chairs, desk and tv. They have a shuttle bus that runs at 10 to the hour and 20 after the hour to the airport and back to the hotel when you get back. They have a resturant attached to the hotel and several restaurants, coffe shops close by. The elevators are quick and there are ice machines, pop machines on every other floor. The checkin person was nice and all we had to do was fill in a form with our type, year, color and license plate number for their files. Wakeup calls are available. We were quite satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: 10withamop
Reviews.Content: Had to spend a week in Toronto for work. Radisson was near my office so, I went with it. Rooms are nice in that you have a separate living room and bedroom, with a nice small kitchen area as you walk in. The rooms and hotel itself are a tad dated. Hotel Staff is very friendly. They do not have free parking so, if you plan on renting car, make sure you add that fee when deciding to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, dark, and crappy service”
Reviews.Author: TuckerHost
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Radissons and I expect a workman-like experience, This hotel is so dated, you expect it to be applying for a pension any day now., Stained furniishings, stained carpeting, gross bathroom fixtures. The decor is so out of date as to appear disgusting. Bedside lights so dim you can't even read,. Outdated and ugly TVs. Staff was indifferent, unhelpful, and seemingly too stupid to perform basic job functions. There appear to be many much better choices for an overnight at the Toronto airport and I'd strongly encourage everyone to choose an alternate until Radisson sees fit to do a long overdue upgrading and replacement of the management. Staff as poor as found at this hotel can only reflect an incompetent and indifferent management.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for airport and a good rate.”
Reviews.Author: CuizaQC
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and it was nice to have a bedroom and a living room. The shower had good water temperature control/pressure. The decor could use some updating and the Wi-Fi is spotty. I enjoyed having a choice of restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the airport and Niagara but not for down town Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TWMC2010
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to be spending two nights here but our flight was forced to return to London due to a fault so we arrived a day late, we were able to e-mail the hotel to let them know of our delay but this was after the normal change period. However they were still happy to bill us for just one night which was a pleasant surprise, we would just have been glad to insure our rooms were kept. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable and the rooms were of a good size with separate bed room and lounge/work areas. the location is just minutes from the airport but a long way from downtown (you can just about make out the CN Tower) If you are thinking to visit Niagara Falls this is an ideal base to explore from after arriving in Toronto. The included breakfast was a little basic but still hit the spot, if you don't have breakfast included there is a Tim Hortonâ€™s just outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: linlynch
Reviews.Content: Hello Readers and Fellow Traveller, The staff here are wonderful I travel 70% of my working time and this hotel has truly become my home away from home. The one bedroom suites are wonderful-all the rooms are one bedroom spacious units and clean and comfortable. The price is a great value. The location is terrific-10 minutes to airport, 5 minutes to 401, 10 minutes to 427. Shopping, Dining , all within minutes. Great restaurant on site which provides cozy dining or room service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room (suite) at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: sci_biz_traveler
Reviews.Content: Reserved a king bed room thru Hotels.com but got a king suite room with a SleepNumber bed. Very clean room and helpful staff, including a concierge. Price and room was much better than the DoubleTree Hotel just across the street. Only complaint was that we were in the takeoff path of the airport but was fairly quiet (hardly noticeable) inside my room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zdubya36
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise... When we booked this hotel we expected your regular run of the mill Radisson airport style hotel. When we opened the doors however we were greeted with a great surprise. The rooms are HUGE. When you enter you have a Mini Bar area, Large couch, Chair, Desk/Chair, Coffee Table and TV Armoire (Not flat screen). There are seperated vanity and bath/toilet rooms. and a huge bedroom with seperate TV and on every floor except for the 16th you get a sleep number bed. Rooms are very clean and did i mention HUGE. The are is as you would expect for a hotel by the airport surrounded by restaurants and other hotels but it butts up against a large convention center which is unique and something to keep in mind if you have a conference in that building. We didn't try room service or the hotel restaurant so we cannot comment on those features. Parking costs 12.00 per day (although if you are brave enough you may be able to park for free at one of the adjacent businesses... i wasn't willing to take the chance) Overall we had a 5/5 experience at this hotel and will be happy to return when we visit Toronto again!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: flyguy35
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as it was the hotel of choice for our conference. Having stayed at other Radissons in the last few years I knew that this hotel was not going to blow me away. Radisson is not the quality hotel chain that it once was and I would now compare it to a Holiday Inn. The rooms were good size but very dated and is past due for updating. The internet speed is ok but slow at times. This hotel is directly on the flight path to one of the runways so be prepared for aircraft noise. The bar/resturant is also in need of updating, to say this place is dated is an understatement. I did not have any problems with the hotel and nothing overly bad or positive stands out. There are a number of other new hotels in the area and had it not been for work insisting that I stay here for the conference, I would have booked one of those hotels. There are number of good places to eat at the end of the parking lot and if you are a Timmies fan, then you will be happy to know that there is one right in front of the main enterance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, a great value.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very good value for under $100; they sometimes sell on hotwire. Clean, spacious and modern rooms are nearly double the size of a typical 3-star offering. Nice decor all-around; this is a well-groomed property. Effective soundproofing of walls between rooms- I never heard a thing. Super-comfortable sleep number beds & nice variety of pillows (both soft & hard). Instant hot water. Located well off the main road, thus no street noise. Easy to get to 401. Liked having Swiss Chalet right outside the front lobby. Pleasant & efficient staff. Cons: Very little to complain about. Charging $11.99/night for parking seems egregious given that this is a remote business district 25km from the CN Tower. Better signage on the main road would be useful. Shower pressure was off; upon flipping the bath to shower switch, only 50% would transfer to the shower nozzle, though likely just a room-specific issue. Lone computer in main lobby was among the slowest I've ever used, thus it's best to bring a laptop. Despite advertising that there are newspapers on every floor, I never saw one anywhere in the hotel over a three-day period.

Reviews.Title: “All You Are Looking for in an Airport Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2eratics
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property twice in 2010 on business trips. The rooms are large if somewhat a bit dated (older TVs, the tubs are a bit 'rough" and the woodwork has seen a lot of errand suitcases), the beds are large and comfortable, there is a nice selection of amenities and there are large window that open. You don't go there for the view (Park N Fly lot) but it is convenient and good value for the room rate. The attached restaurant (don't remember the name - "The Hairy Fox" or something like that) has a good hot and cold breakfast buffet. The service is very prompt and the coffee is good. If you crave Tim's, there are two of them literally out the front door. There are also a couple of roadhouse-type restaurants within easy walking distance. The shuttle service from the airport (which is why I have stayed here) is prompt and the drivers tend to be good humoured for what they go through. The only negative aspect is the walls in the rooms seem fairly thin - to the point where I could hear the guy next door yawning. That was relatively minor. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antigua1999
Reviews.Content: I had a great night at this hotel and highly reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but where's the hospitality gone?”
Reviews.Author: NorOnt
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel a few times now for business. It's a good location, our room was lovely and fairly quiet which is important when you are working. BUT on our arrival this last visit on March 21, we arrived from the airport at noon. We were attending a trade show right next door at the Congress Centre so we just wanted to drop our bags and get to work. We were greated by the most disinterested person...indifferent is maybe a better word. There was no smile....hardly any eye contact....just a blunt "check in isn't till 3 p.m." I was fully aware of this and just wanted to leave our bags as we have in the past., which the woman told us was alright. Then we were left to stand there for another five minutes while the man who was supposed to tag our bags was on the phone. That's fine, but the gal behind the counter could have looked after them i'm sure. I must mention that there wasn't another soul around so it's not like they were swamped with customers. It was the attitude or lack of HOSPITALITY that really annoyed us. What ever happened to greetings like "welcome to the Raddison" ...maybe said with a smile. That is hospitality. If I treated the customers that come in my business that way I'm sure I would lose a few. Keep in mind there are lots of alternative hotels very close by. Maybe a minor issue...but I thought it was worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Cashmere67
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT: size of one bedroom suite, comfort of bed, sheets, pillows, city lights view on west side of building, service, excellent pressure in the shower, bar fridge for the bottled water we brought with us. GOOD : restaurants in area are abundant, all walking distance, including a Tim Horton's in the parking lot POOR: windows don't open, no fresh air whatsoever, no balcony, stuffy air, extra $4 charge for a bottle of water (if you choose to open it.. which we never do.. we always bring our own, so having a fridge in the room is great). Too many doors, open one to close the other, etc. Would rather have a car to take in sights and sounds of Toronto, and not be stuck on Dixon Road for an extended period of time. If you do have a car, it's only short distance to Downtown Toronto or Vaughn, another shopping Mecca north of Toronto. Paid $155/night in mid March for two people. Fair price in Toronto for a clean, comfortable one-bedroom unit.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful night. The room was...”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly74
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful night. The room was huge and very clean and the staff were all very nice. We will definitely return to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch room for a low price.”
Reviews.Author: tfuel
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes to airport, park and fly shuttle included. room was very nice and Sleep number beds are fantastic. Definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: rubytuOntario
Reviews.Content: Are you flying out of Pearson ? Stay at the Raddison hotel. For less than the cost of parking we stayed at a beautiful clean hotel ( great beds) were shuttled to and from the airport in clean vehicles and are car was safely parked for the week. We will certainly do this for our next vacation or stay here on our next business trade show in Toronto Thanks

Reviews.Title: “top notch service”
Reviews.Author: famtimeOntario
Reviews.Content: From the front desk attendant to the shuttle driver,all were most accommodating and helpful. Quick and courteous!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Misty58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of a 2 week holiday. We were very pleased with the room. Large suite, everything nice and clean. The only complaint would have been the long wait for the shuttle. We came into the airport at 2 a.m. and though when we called we were told it would be only a 20 minute wait, we waited more than 40 minutes for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Decent loaction with lots of food options nearby, shuttle service slow”
Reviews.Author: brownman
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because of a Travel Zoo rate. We had an early morning flight and wanted to reduce stress. The location is good. It's family close to the airport but it's not one of the closest hotels. It's still a 5+ minute drive to the airport. We checked in late Sunday night on our way back from MontrÃ©al. There is a visitors parking area in front of the hotel. We parked there and checked in. the hotel is a bit old but the service is really good. The staff is normally at the back and it takes them about a minute or less to realize that someone is waiting for them at the desk. The rooms are big. With a sofa bed by the TV and desk and two sleep number beds in their own bedroom. The bathroom is small with a tub and toilet. The vanity is outside so some can use it while someone else is taking a shower. The rooms are dated but not bad if you have a few people sharing the room. The hotel is in a business plaza with lots of restaurants right outside of the hotel. I suppose you could even park there for free but we didn't want to risk it. We decided to return our rental car early so that we have less hassle in the morning. On check in were were asked, if we needed to take the shuttle. This hotel requires a validated shuttle pass in order to use the shuttle. If you have booked in the hotel, once you get dropped off at the hotel, the driver waits until you check in and give him a pass. The pass is free for hotel guests. This takes some time. I found it a bit annoying but that's okay. The shuttle services to other hotels so budget at least 15 minutes for the ride to the airport and back. We waited for a bit at the airport and at the hotel in morning for the shuttle to show up.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy service, dated and old - you can do better”
Reviews.Author: Jon39
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very tired, and front desk service was awful. Plenty of better airport hotels for this money. Plus parking is extra, and you need to get a ticket for the airport shuttle (which reception omits to tell you, assuming you can find somebody manning the desk)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: CJTravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson Suites Airport Toronto on two occasions, once in 2007and again in June 2009. On both occasions I was there for meetings. I was pleased with the hotel; the suites are fairly large; my room had two televisions, two telephones, a large bathroom, and a spacious meeting area that could be shut off from the bedroom. In addition, the staff was efficient and very friendly, and the food in the Fox Bistro restaurant was very good. It is convenient to the airport and the hotel provides a shuttle to the Toronto International Airport. The hotel provides free wireless capabilities. If I were to offer criticism, because of its proximity to the airport, airplanes flying overhead can be heard. Too, it is quite some distance from downtown Toronto. For in-and-out meetings this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Montrealeronthemove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Suites Airport for 2 nights at the beginning of June 2009. We had an excellent stay. The hotel is a good distance from downtown and could be a real plus depending on the reason (and place) you need it for. The hotel is just off exit 354 of Hwy 401. You don't have to look for it: it's right there! The outside look is ordinary. The spacious suite-style rooms though are outstanding(see photos). We arrived a bit before 3pm and the attendant checked us in immediately. The staff is professional, helpful and really nice. We were assigned room 1015. I had read reviews about the noise of the airplanes if you were on a higher floor. Well... we were there on Friday which is probably the busiest day (flights in and out) and we could hardly hear the planes. When they land, some fly just over the hotel, you hear a light rumble for about a second or two. Everything stopped around 10pm! The next day, we were back in the afternoon for a while and hardly heard any. For those not used to Radisson, their sleep-number beds are great. There is a TV in the bedroom area as well as in the living room. The air-conditionning can be a bit noisy. At this hotel there is a charge for parking. At the time we travelled it was $11.99 per day, with in and out privileges. The only problem we had was the that, even if we registered our car with the reception of the hotel, the next morning we saw the attendant ticketing our car, taking pictures of the car etc. I proceeded immediately to the reception and gave them the ticket. The reception attendant told me to leave it with him, that it would be setlled. I think that they should have a pass system with stamped date to put in the windshield of your car instead of that registering system. It would avoid aggravation with wanna-be policemen who only want to show their power as security agents. Apart from this, I could only find good to say. The concierge in service in the evening was really nice and helpful about directions and restaurants. Whenever we needed something we got it either right away or brought to the room very shortly after. Everyone there gave excellent service. Sharing the parking lot of the hotel there is a Tim Horton's(actually 2 of them), Swiss Chalet and another restaurant (which I don't remember the name), plus the hotel's on-site restaurant (Fox Bistro (?)). I had read reviews saying that restaurants were far and that a good breakfast was hard to get in the area... well, we found full breakfast places within walking distance. For golfers there is a golf not far at James Gardens. The Toronto Conference Center is the neighbour of the Hotel. Talking about value, Radisson have a "Free Friday" promotion at this location, which means that if you stay either a Thursday and Friday or Friday and Saturday, you get the Friday free. All together for two nights and parking it cost 159.00$ CAD. I am sure that the pictures will tell it all about the room. The only thing I forgot to take a photo of, is the sink area. There is also a litlle fridge and coffee maker which is just behind the desk. We will definitely stay there again. The room, the staff we had during our stay, made it worthwhile to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Stopover - Very nice and clean place”
Reviews.Author: dssdt1
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night at this hotel the night before we flew out to the DR. Very friendly staff and beautiful suite for a standard room. Only paid $109 CAN which included the week of parking and 24 hour shuttle service. You can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Martin1452
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Suites Toronto Airport the night before our flight to Miami. Although there for only one night, we experienced great service and a beautiful suite. The room was very roomy and seemed recently renovated. The staff very attentive and responded quickly when we asked for an extra blanket and pillows for the kids. The people at front desk were very cordial and helped us with our transfers to the airport on the free shuttle service they offer. All in all, I would recommend this great hotel for all it has to offer and it's outstanding service. You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “false advertisment, discramination, not treatet equaly”
Reviews.Author: irena_petrovik
Reviews.Content: if you are smoker just do not go to this hotel. smokers are getting the worst regural beds, see-through blankets.i booked room that was advertised and spouse to have sleep number beds and dawn comforter but i got nothing of that. the response the hotel gave me it was because i was in a smoking room. terible experience. i was punished and not threated equaly just because i smoke...intresting..is it the law that you need to threat people equaly, and do not advertize things that you can give to somebody? yes that is the law, but here it was not respected. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Conference Stay”
Reviews.Author: MappingGuy51
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Airport Radisson for a conference for two mid week nights in October. I have stayed here previously, with the same overall experience. The rooms were well kept and clean, appreciated housekeeping asking if I needed my room/sheets made when meeting them in the hallway. I found the front desk staff service to be somewhat poor when checking in, compared to other hotels. Additionally, I booked a King Suite, directly through Radisson over two months in advance, though upon arrival the room I had booked wasn't available and I was given a room with 2 double beds. This wasn't a large inconvenience, as I was staying alone, however if my wife had traveled with me as she planned, the story might have been different. I would have assumed that a booking and confirmation so early would have been trouble free. There are a couple of dining location just outside of the hotel, however if you are staying more than a couple of nights you will need to travel If your staying for more than one night your meal choices are limited without driving. Finding a good breakfast is difficult, the in hotel restaurant is offers a buffet and menu in the morning which will make due but is well overpriced for the level of service and quality. There are three Tim Hortonâ€™s just steps away, but don't provide full breakfast that most business people need to jump start the day. Finding a good breakfast is difficult, the in hotel restaurant is offers a buffet and menu in the morning which will make due but is well overpriced for the level of service and quality. There are two Tim Hortonâ€™s just steps away, but don't provide full breakfast that most business people need to jump start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Inexperienced Staff”
Reviews.Author: scapaflow40
Reviews.Content: The Raddison is a fairly typical mid-range airport hotel. I booked a suite as i was traveling with my two children. The rooms were on the small side and the decor was dated. I would say I paid about $40 ($220 per night) too much when looking at the quality and size of the room. What made the stay a little more challenging was that my daughter became ill during the night and I needed to get the bed linens changed. A call to the front desk quickly revealed that the fellow who had checked me in was about the only staff member in what is a fairly large hotel. To top it off he was almost brand new and told me that before he could give me a linen change he would need to speak to his manager who I think was safely at home. Anyway, to his credit the manager did call me and linens did arrive (although not quite the right ones). When I suggested to the staffer that he might want to remove the soiled and smelly linens (now in a plastic bag and placed there by me) out of the hallway he said that he would need to talk to his manager again. Wonder what would have happened if there had been a fire? Bottom line is that a hotel of that size probably needs to reconsider leaving a junior person in charge even if the manager is a phone call away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii50Lover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson on June 23 and 24. If you want to tour downtown Toronto, you will need a rental car because it's not that close to downtown. The suite was very spacious. The decor (paintings, carpet, tile, and especially the "wet bar") was a bit dated but clean. The parking costs $7.95 CAD per day. If you want the newspaper, it's $0.75 CAD per day unless you decline it at check in. These fees really did not bother me much because they cost much more at a hotel in downtown. We booked the room on Hotwire for $50 per night. After taxes, it was a little over $60 which was quite good. The only negative thing I have to comment about is that my credit card was charged again when I have already paid for the room through Hotwire. This was promptly resolved by making a phone call but this shouldn't have happend in the first place. One more thing, if you are very sensitive to airplane noises, you may want to avoid staying near this hotel. While I was there, they planes flew RIGHT OVER the hotel every few minutes until about 11pm. It didn't bother me much as I am a sound sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out very nice”
Reviews.Author: BrianMa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a place where we could meet our brother in law for part of the day as well as meet her sister flying in near midnight. We like to watch hockey and have a few beers, so with several bar type restaurants just out front of the hotel it was pretty handy. We met up with my wifes son and girlfriend and the 4 of us had plenty of room in this pretty nice hotel. The beds are those sleep number ones(very comfortable). Lots of room. A fridge and sink came in handy and no trouble hooking to the internet or watching a great tv. For 4 people these rooms are pretty good and the hotel staff was very friendly and had no problems filling our special requests. No pool here.

Reviews.Title: “Where we got vacation started”
Reviews.Author: THEHIPSTER
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel and a stay and fly option. Was a great deal! I could not believe the size of the rooms once we got checked in. We got 2 rooms on with a King and one with 2 doubles. The one with 2 doubles was far larger. They were clean and spacious. There was a special area where we could leave our vehicles for up to 2 weeks. It actually worked out to be cheaper than the park and fly. You get 2 shuttles passes for there and back and each extra person is $6. Shuttle took about 6 minutes to get to the Airport. The phone number was on the tickets for the way back, called and we blinked and he was asking if we were the ones that called. Excellent service. The Fox Bistro inside the hotel was a great little hotel bar as well and the service we recieved from Stanley was awesome. Going on a trip next month and going to use this hotel again,

Reviews.Title: “Well Used Rooms - But a Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bassmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in conjunction with a business trip next door at the Centre. Very nice hotel, with pleasant staff. The rooms were clean and updated, but showed signs of a lot of usage and wear. Not the end of the world there, though - it was still nice. The hotel is located within walking distance to many restaurants and shops - including subs, bar& grills, sushi, and fast food/donut shops. I was excited to try the sleep-number bed they provide at this facility - and I could have done without it. It felt like I was sleeping on an inflated Ziploc bag - and I could not get comfortable any of the nights I stayed there (woke up sore in the back, honestly). I stayed at a dumpy Super 8 the next night on my way to my next location and got a better nights sleep with a traditional mattress! All together, a very nice facility. I left knowing I was taken care of as well as with a mental note to not buy a Sleep Number bed for at home!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryDoyler
Reviews.Content: Worked out great for our trip. Free internet, close to the airport and quiet spacious room. Sleep number bed was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location but noisy executive floors”
Reviews.Author: eatondogs
Reviews.Content: We were here for a trade show at the Congress Centre and booked into the Radisson due to its location (beside the Congress Centre) and excellent rate. Check in was quick and we got our room as booked, non-smoking executive floor with two double beds. Upon entering the room we were pleased with the large work desk and heavenly looking beds. After we returned from dinner we were astounded at how clearly you could hear the planes overhead. When you stay at the airport you expect some plane noise (except at the Sheraton Terminal 3 where you hear nothing!) but this was rediculous. The executive floors are the top three so the lower floors my not hear them as badly. It continued through the night and then again early in the morning. When I called and asked if we would be under the flight path again for our second night I was informed the hotel is ALWAYS under the flight path! I am surprised that the windows aren't better insulated. Overall the hotel is great, clean and comfortable but beware of the overhead noises!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the bright lights of the front and center rooms”
Reviews.Author: LordRybo
Reviews.Content: Above average for a hotel geared at the business traveler, and so close to the airport. Nothing worth remembering in the lobby. The restaurant does a good serve yourself kind of breakfast witht he typical items which are very edible. Make sure to order a room with a sleep number bed. This made all fo the difference in the quality of your sleep. Avoid rooms on the front and center of the hotel. The bright lights which illuminate the hotel at night will shine right into your room, and make it very bright at night. The drapes will close, but never quite far enough to block out the light.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice airport hotel..”
Reviews.Author: nicebizguy
Reviews.Content: Very nice airport hotel. Good for business, lots of room. Was VERY happy they had wireless in the room. Upon my arrival, I was upgraded to a better room, which was very much appreciated and will probably result in my staying there the next time I am in the area. There are also a number of casual sitdown restaurants only a 1 minute walk away from the front door. The staff was great. My main irritant was the fact how the airport shuttle worked was not explained to me. It is not a hotel shuttle, but a shuttle that serves a number of hotels. Although I have no problem with that, I was standing around at the airport for 20 minutes looking for a van that had the hotels name on it, which it did not. It was also not explained to me that there is a $6 charge. Again, not a big deal, but was not explained to me when I called the front office and inquired about it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific choice at the airport”
Reviews.Author: buddha1
Reviews.Content: Great place at the airport. The room was spotless and very spacious. Internet available in the room, comfortable furniture and fantastic bed. Room had every amenity I could ask for. Microwave, fridge, coffee, bathrobes etc, etc, etc. Front desk and concierge staff were great. The restaurant isn't fine dining but it is what it is. More than adequete for weary travellers. For the price, best choice for me at Pearson.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: coronationcats
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting too much from this hotel but was pleasantly surprised when we stepped into our room and found it spacious, comfortable, clean and tastefully decorated. Everything was top notch from start to finish. I actually told my husband I wish we'd spent our two week vacation THERE rather than Cuba! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the airport vacinity and will definitely chose this Radisson again when booking accommodation near the airport. (parking and shuttle were included in our very reasonable rate)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: oceanbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: With a Christmas party we were going to right next door, we stayed the night at this hotel, and found it great. Being a suite it had two tvs, with one in the living area and one in the bedroom. The beds were great, with you being in control of how hard you wanted the matress , with the nice duvet and nice pillows on the bed. Lots of resturants, in the area, so if you didn't want to drive, there are a few within walking distance , and of course Tims right outside the door. You do hear the plans at night and early in the morning, but you are right near the airport so it's expected. Staff were friendly and helpful. Hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmalzone
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews we read. It is definitely not the closest hotel to the airport. There are many other hotels on the road closer to the Toronto airport. The Radisson also does not have a shuttle service. We selected a nonsmoking room which was on a nonsmoking floor. However, it definitely smelled like an older smoking floor and the room actually had ashtrays. While it was clean, I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rainbwblu
Reviews.Content: Staff was very frie.ndly from the moment we arrived. Express check-in was a bit slower than expected but still fast. We booked a room in the business class floor. The front desk called a few minutes after we arrived in our room to see if it was okay. They only had smoking rooms available in the business class so we moved to a non-smoking room on a normal floor. The room was basically identical except it didnt have a printer or microwave. Also no free continental breakfast on the normal floors. Since they have no continental breakfast, you can order from room service for $10+ per person. We did order room service at 10pm and the food was very good and the price wasnt bad considering it was roomservice. They do not have a pool, hot tub or sauna. They do have a small exercise room. It is within walking distance of a few restaurants. It is very close to the airport. All the rooms in this hotel are deluxe suites. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable - its a sleep number bed. They have a fridge and mini bar with fairly reasonable prices compared to other hotels. You can hear planes overhead which wasnt a problem for us since we are used to it. Parking is $8/day. Staff was very friendly. The hotel seems to cater to a lot of business travelers. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Radisson not too long ago, and I loved it. The staff was kind and helpful. The service they provide is beyond excellent. They also have meeting space for any1 who is interested, and I heard the meeting rooms are in very good condition. The hotel is conviniently located to the airport, 15 minute ride to downtown, lots of restaurants and places to shop. Overall I am very pleased with Radisson by the airport and will definetly stay there in the future!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Suite Hotel Toronto Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 640 Dixon Road, Toronto, Ontario M9W 1J1, Canada
